title: Deep Learning Framework for Language Identification in Mixed-Script Texts

context.prior_knowledge: Basic natural language processing (NLP) and deep learning model understanding, with Python programming experience
context.additional_context: Provision of smartphone-based accessible VR simulation environments, utilizing mixed data samples from actual codes of Facebook/Twitter/WhatsApp

learning_goals: Achieve over 85% word-level language identification accuracy in Hindi-English code-mixed text.
Develop the ability to design language identification frameworks using BLSTM and Word2Vec (cBoW/Skip-gram) models.

Learners can collect 3 samples of code-mixing data from social media platforms (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook), compare them based on 3 complexity metrics (token diversity, language-switching frequency, code ratio), and submit visualized results in tables and graphs.

resources: Google Colab or lightweight local deep learning environment
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
